abstract: New York's Hot 97 radio show has lost some of its most recognizable DJs, raising questions about its status as one of nation's most venerable rap outlets; interviews with departed DJs and hosts, some of whom witnessed birth and rise of hip-hop during their time at station, reveal abiding concern that station has succumbed to the homogenization of urban radio.
lead_paragraph: Some recognizable names have left Hot 97, while outside voices have come in. And that raises concerns about the station’s status as a top rap outlet.

headline.main: For Hip-Hop Radio and Its Voices, Change Is on the Air
headline.print_headline: For Hip-Hop Radio and Its Voices, Change Is on the Air
headline.seo: Hot 97, a Hip-Hop Pioneer on Radio, Reaches a Crossroads

snippet: Some recognizable names have left Hot 97, while outside voices have come in. And that raises concerns about the station’s status as a top rap outlet.
